oai_dc:dc.dc:title: DUNE FORMATION AND STABILIZATION BY VEGETATION AND PLANTINGS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Davis, John H.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: coastal dunes
dune stabilization
dune plantings
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Plantings of appropriate native and introduced plants and the management of extant vegetation are often very effective in promoting the development and maintenance of dunes that serve to protect shores against some types of erosion. The importance of dunes as barriers, the formation of dunes, and the role of plants and vegetation are considered. The types of vegetation of the three zones usually present over dune fields are described, and the general management to maintain such vegetation is discussed. Methods of making plantings on natural and artificial dunes by selecting, seeding, and transplanting the species that are most effective in building and stabilizing dunes are given.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 6 (1957): Proceedings of 6th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Gainesville, Florida, 1957.; 29
